adventure_overview: Itâ€™s time to take flight. Do you know the secret to making a paper airplane fly longer or farther? In this Adventure, you will have fun making different types of airplanes and other flying objects. Before any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

content.value: Make a paper airplane and fly it five times. Record the flight distance and time.

requirements.text: Make a paper airplane and fly it five times. Record the flight distance and time.

activities.name: Make a Paper Airplane
activities.description: Cub Scouts make and fly a paper airplane.

content.value: Make a paper airplane of a different design and fly it five times. Record the flight distance and time.

requirements.text: Make a paper airplane of a different design and fly it five times. Record the flight distance and time.

activities.name: Paper Airplane Comparison
activities.description: Cub Scouts will make a different paper airplane design and fly it five times.

content.value: Compare and contrast the two paper airplanes by distance and flight times.

requirements.text: Compare and contrast the two paper airplanes by distance and flight times.

activities.description: Cub Scouts participate in a paper airplane derby.

activities.description: Cub Scouts will play paper airplane golf.

activities.description: Cub Scouts participate in a paper airplane obstacle course.

content.value: Build a flying object that is not a paper airplane.
